div.p: RB MSS M58, Library, Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: center;
font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: MS annotation by M: 'Answ 6/11/94'. Letter not found.

p.seg: C. of E. Grammar School, Geelong

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: MS bears the coat of arms of the Church of England Grammar School, Geelong, Vic.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt;

div.p: I have had the pleasure of once more hearing from Prof. Agardh, and am glad to learn that our last sending of Algs contained some interesting forms — To quote his ipsissima verba "Though the collection from you last season contains a less number of different species, there are several of much interest to me, as being in new states, and others perhaps forms of new species, which I am going to study more closely as soon as possible" — Amongst the plants considered to be entirely new are the following.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
Laurencia urnigera.
No description by Agardh under this name has been found (AlgaeBase, accessed 19 May 2022). A misreading by Wilson for Laurencia uncinata?

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
p.name: Dasya comata

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: This species was not formally published until 1998, having been 'a name used by J. Agardh on specimens from Western Port … but never published' ( http://www.flora.sa.gov.au/efsa/Marine_Benthic_Flora_SA/Part_IIIC/Dasya_comata.shtml accessed 19 May 2022). MEL 1006688 is a specimen collected by Wilson, dated 17 January 1894.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
p.name: Dasya struthiopenna

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
p.name: Chondriopsis deflexa

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: Name not found (AlgaeBase, accessed 19 May 2022), but no search through the ca. 350 specimens collected by Wilson and now at MEL has been undertaken.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
p.name: Sphaeroclinium rhytidophlaeum

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
Hymenocladia nitophylloides.
Name not found (AlgaeBase, accessed 19 May 2022).

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
p.name: Kallymenia palmatifida

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt;

div.p: and some others not yet named

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt;

div.p: A Sphacelaria, Dictyota, 2 sp. and a Schizymenia —

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt;

div.p:
I quite hoped to have extended my researches this next season beyond the Otway
i.e. Otway Ranges, usually referred to as 'the Otways'. All places named are in Vic. at Warrnambool & Port Fairy & perhaps Portland but greatly fear I shall have to abandon the project on account of the bad times which have greatly curtailed my means and made every expense a serious consideration.
i.e. the economic depression of the 1890s.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt;

div.p: I enclose two scraps of plants from W. Australia which a lady gave my daughter while travelling. If you can identify them from such small pieces I should like to know their names — also the proper botanical appellation of the plant called in N.S.W. the Edelweis or flannel flower

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
